Art. 4.219. Lapse 
Any testamentary disposition lapses if the person in whose favour it is made does not survive the testator.
A testamentary disposition lapses if the legatee renounces it or is incapable of receiving it.
A legacy lapses if the bequeathed property has completely perished during the testator's lifetime.
The legacy also lapses if the property has perished since the death, through no fault of the heir, even if the heir has been given notice to deliver it, if the property would also have perished in the hands of the legatee.
